revised_title: A New Dodecapodous Pycnogonid Species Discovered in Antarctica
tldr: The authors discovered a new species of pycnogonid with six leg-bearing somites in Antarctica. This unique specimen, named Dodecolopoda mawsoni, has a significant impact on the understanding of the morphology and phylogeny of the Pycnogonida. The authors discuss the possible implications of this discovery on the evolution of the group and its relation to other arthropods.
